Case reference: 2018062818.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1993, at approximately 1:30am, Rafat Abugazia was last seen by his roommate in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006281.CaseDesc: Originally from the Ivory Coast, Mr. Anvire moved to Ottawa when he was 11 years old and remained in Ottawa until his disappearance in 2009. Mr. Anvire contacted his employer in October 2009 and stated that he was going to Montreal and has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001139.CaseDesc: On August 4, 1974, the skeletal remains of a teenage boy were discovered under a log near Lost Lagoon in Stanley Park, Vancouver, British Columbia. He was believed to have died at least a year before his discovery.

Pants: Corduroy, Dark Blue, Button fly pants
Sweater: Synthetic, Dark Blue, Turtleneck, Knitted turtleneck sweater

Case reference: 2006018799.CaseDesc: Michael Recollet was last seen on August 20, 1991 at Okeechobee Lodge Dock, in Fraser Point. He was  heading in a westerly direction towards Birch Island by boat. His 16 foot cedar strip boat and 25HP Mariner motor were recovered near Mary's Point, Little La Cloche Island.

Case reference: 2015066998.CaseDesc:
Yvon Shawn Guignard moved to the northern part of Manitoba during the summer of 2015 in search of employment, with interests in Churchill and the Northwest Territories. While in Thompson, he adopted a transient lifestyle, living in his personal vehicle and developing friendships with the homeless community. 
It’s believed Mr. Guignard was last seen on November 28, 2015 at approximately 6:45am. Just prior to his disappearance, he made a number of attempts to give away his personal vehicle, which was located at the time he was reported missing. According to his family, he is schizophrenic, with a medical condition and he also has a history of not taking his prescription medications. He has been known to travel to undisclosed locations within the country and act secretive with family as to his whereabouts. He should not be approached as he may be in medical distress.

Case reference: 2021043326.CaseDesc: In the evening of September 20, 2021, Jeremiah Guthro was seen for the last time as he walked away from his residence in the Glebe neighbourhood in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2023053891.CaseDesc: On June 17th, 2023, Elora Patoine was last seen when she was dropped off in Borden, Prince Edward Island.  She was then driven to Moncton, New Brunswick, where she remained until June 19th.  Elora has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Leather, Brown, Faux leather brown coat

Case reference: 2014004476.CaseDesc: Gayebrella King was reported missing by her family on May 8, 1980. She was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta in late August 1978.

Case reference: 2014005155.CaseDesc: Harold Murray Harvey was seen for the last time by a neighbour in front of his residence in Pincourt on September 14, 2008. Mr. Harvey was reported missing by a family member on September 19, 2008. At the time of his disappearance he was taking medication, which he left behind. Mr. Harvey had left his home a few times in the past but always returned after a couple of days.

Case reference: 2014004267.CaseDesc: On December 16, 2002, Jason MacMillan was reported missing. His brother last saw Jason on December 10, 2002 at 12:30 am when they were together on Jasper Avenue and 102 Street in Edmonton, Alberta.

Scar: Neck, scar on his neck in the throat area

Case reference: 1999108210.CaseDesc: René Bessette was abducted when he was 8 years old by his father, Roger Bessette, leaving behind his mother and siblings.  His father's car was found abandoned later on the Victoria Bridge in Montreal.  The photos of René have been age-progressed to 40 years old.

Case reference: 2006000199.CaseDesc: October 26, 1986, an unidentified man was found under the ramp to the Gardiner Expressway and Spadina Avenue behind 252 Queens Quay West, in Toronto, Ontario. He was well-nourished, and was found not wearing any clothing.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Male pattern baldness, 4mm facial stubble
Mark: Left Elbow, Small mole on the side of his left elbow

Case reference: 2014004923.CaseDesc: On July 24th, 1973, Robert Chaple was reported missing. He was last seen arriving home on July 11th in the early morning hours.

Case reference: 2014004654.CaseDesc: Richard Brokke was last seen at approximately 8:10 a.m. on July 15, 2005 leaving the 7-11 Store on St. Mary's Road in Winnipeg. His vehicle was located on July 19, 2005 near St. Jean Baptiste, Manitoba. Mr. Brokke's whereabouts remain unknown.

Shirt: Denim, White, Green, Golf shirt with green stripes on front

Case reference: 2014003474.CaseDesc: Christine Pelletier was last seen on July 21, 1988, in the Vieux-Rosemont District of Montreal, Quebec. Christine lived with friends, was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle, and may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, Winged horse on the back of the shoulder. Possibly a Pegasus

Case reference: 2007003599.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2000 Marilyn Zaitzeff left her cottage located on Lambert Island, Lake Superior. She was operating a personal watercraft at the time. The watercraft was located overturned several hundred metres away from the cottage. Mrs. Zaitzeff has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2020010761.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1983, at approximately 11:00am, Rudolf Jakob was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Shirt: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Striped; Light blue and dark blue

Case reference: 2021019974.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2021, Jason Lambert was reported missing by his family.  Jason was last seen on or about April 16, 2021, departing from a residence in Oliver, British Columbia.  Jason has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003272.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1967 Michael Smith left his North Vancouver residence. Mr. Smith had been despondent over a friend’s death and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2014005292.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1992, at approximately 6:30am, Renata Ejsmont was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The day before her disappearance, Renata had quit her job and told her former employer that she was moving back to Poland.

Case reference: 2014005245.CaseDesc: Ka Hung Mok, was last seen by a family member around June 15, 1995 in Lasalle, Québec. He left the family home alone by car. The family later discovered that the vehicle had returned to the driveway, but Ka Hung was not seen and has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2024009413.CaseDesc: On November 08, 2023, a young woman was found sitting on a chair in the bushes near the north end of the Knight St Bridge in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was very thin but otherwise healthy, and died from illicit drug poisoning.

Hair: Brown, Red, Short, Wavy, Brown hair dyed red
Sweater: Cotton, Light Blue, “Old Navy” brand hoodie, size medium
Underwear: Cloth, Dark Blue, “Forever 21” brand bra, size small

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976

Case reference: 2013000021.CaseDesc: Bones of a right foot with its sock and shoe were found along the bank of the Ottawa river in Gatineau, Quebec.

Case reference: 2006017699.CaseDesc: Marianne Minor was a resident of the St. Thomas Psychiatric Hospital in 1984. She left her ward to go to the canteen and has never been seen again.

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2019044701.CaseDesc: On August 5, 2019, at approximately 6:00 am, Bridget Dalbe was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004526.CaseDesc: In 1999, Jesse Jurak was seen for the last time as he attended a family funeral in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020056.CaseDesc: Sylvia Ann Guiboche was last seen around mid June 2003.  Sylvia is known to frequent the Sargent Avenue/Ellice Avenue area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.  Sylvia is at high risk of being exploited.

Other: Abdomen, Was 6-9 months pregnant at time of disappearance

Case reference: 2006027999.CaseDesc: On August 15, 1986 Clayton Duncan McFaul was last seen by a family member on the family farm near Havelock Ontario. Mr. McFaul was completing his usual daily farm chores. He was very punctual about meal times, so when he failed to arrive for his lunch his family were concerned. An extensive search failed to locate Mr. McFaul.  Several possible sightings were reported after August 15, 1986, but none led to Mr. McFaul's location.

Hair: Bald, White, Other, Bald with fringe

Case reference: 2014002562.CaseDesc: Michael Megraw, from Minnesota, USA, had visited the Katamik Lake area with his brother to go fishing over the September Labour Day weekend in September 1992.  Michael had returned to the US but was reported missing just days later, family indicated he was last seen on September 11, 1992.  RCMP received a call on October 3, 1992, about a truck at Katamik Lake which didn't appear to have been moved since September 24th; Mr. Megraw was determined to be the registered owner.  It is believed he returned to the lake somewhere between September 11 and September 24, 1992. Mr. Megraw has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2008019999.CaseDesc: Patrick O’Connell has been missing since July 4, 2008. He was last seen by a friend and roommate. Patrick suffers from schizophrenia, substance abuse issues, and has previously made comments that he may harm himself.

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2014004976.CaseDesc: Beric Bason was last seen on July 22, 2007 at Loon Lake Resort near Clinton, British Columbia.  Beric has not been seen or heard from since and the reason for his disappearance is unknown.

Case reference: 2014005523.CaseDesc: In 1998, Chi Fong was seen for the last time by his mother in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008020999.CaseDesc: Dave MacDermott was last seen on or about Saturday November 9, 2002 in Kitchener, Ontario. He had been out celebrating a friend’s birthday. It was initially reported that Dave left town with his dog and his 1990 Ford Mustang. However, his vehicle was located parked in a parking lot near his residence and his dog was found wandering the neighbourhood.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Some missing teeth with some decay; he has cracked lower left teeth
Boots: Black, Motorcycle boots with a buckle on each boot
Tattoo: Torso (Back), small ladybug between shoulder blades

Case reference: 2014006318.CaseDesc: On November 18, 2013, it is believed that Stewart Ward travelled from Brampton to Niagara Falls, Ontario.  Stewart's vehicle was later located in a parking lot near the Falls.  Stewart has not been seen or heard from.

Case reference: 2010001799.CaseDesc: On the morning of May 18, 1993, Christine Harron stayed home from school as she was not feeling well. Around lunch time Christine and her mother argued about Christine returning to school for the afternoon. Her mother heard Christine leave the house at about 1:30 pm. Christine did not attend school that afternoon and she has not been seen since. The investigation revealed that Christine left the house without her purse, money or knapsack. Subsequent investigation has led to the arrest and conviction of a male in regards to the disappearance of Christine Harron, however her remains have yet to be located.

Glasses: Plastic, Brown, Large rimmed with tape

Case reference: 2014045101.CaseDesc: The partial remains of an older adult female were found near Chasm, British Colombia in 2010. She had no teeth in her lower jaw and had likely gone missing many years earlier.

Case reference: 2014001337.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1983, Micheline Chailler was seen for the last time at her apartment in Lévis, Quebec. Micheline last contacted a member of her family by telephone on March 19, 1983. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Brown, Beige, Brown with beige stripes

Case reference: 2019060163.CaseDesc: On April 7, 2019, Ashley Arason was seen for the last time by her family in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Ashley had missed her son’s birthday, and this was something that was out of character

Tattoo: Right Ankle, Musical notes on a staff
Left Ankle, Chinese writing, strength, butterfly, musical note

Case reference: 2014002175.CaseDesc: On October 29, 1983, Dale Dushinski was seen for the last time. During the time of his disappearance, Dale was canoeing on the Athabasca River. His canoe was later found overturned approximately 10 kms north of Fort McMuray, Alberta.

Scar: A scar from a biopsy, unsure which knee

Case reference: 2014003239.CaseDesc: Craig Rain was last seen at a gas station at Range Road 32 and Highway 16 north of Duffield, Alberta. He had been planning to hitch hike into Edmonton, Alberta, from this location.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Persons head with feathers

Case reference: 2014006380.CaseDesc: Dean Kelly Morrison was last seen October 23, 2013, after being dismissed from his job. His vehicle was left abandoned on a ranch.

Case reference: 2020011116.CaseDesc: Glen Peddle had been hitchhiking through the United States between 1982 and 1985. In April 1985, Glen called his mother from New York to tell her that he was planning on returning home to Newfoundland in the spring, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2006024299.CaseDesc: Harold Cottrell was last seen on September 28, 1984, in a boat on Northwind Lake. It is believed the aluminum boat he was travelling in with some companions, was overloaded. The boat began to sink.  Mr. Cottrell was never located and is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2017056036.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2017, Jason McGrath was last seen modifying his kayak at the family's cottage in Cape George, Nova Scotia. Jason had indicated that he intended on taking the kayak out onto the water. The kayak and Jason’s other personal belongings were recovered on a shore in Judique, Nova Scotia.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Red circle with flames

Case reference: 2014003214.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1982, Clyde "Van" Ditmars was reported missing to the Thunder Bay Police Service by his family. Van sought work in British Columbia, Alberta and Manitoba in the early 1980s as a welder. Since being reported missing, Van's family has not heard from him and his whereabouts are unknown.

Scar: Abdomen, Surgical; from the center of chest to the belt line and then to the left
Abdomen, Surgical, horizontal on the left side
Neck, 1 1-2" raised scar on front of the neck

Case reference: 2014002414.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1983, Michael Milavanov and his father were canoeing on Kingsmere Lake near Waskesiu, SK. The canoe tipped over in rough water. His father survived however searches failed to locate Michael.

Case reference: 2014005526.CaseDesc: Angela Meyer went missing from her parents’ residence. She was on a weekend pass from Stanton Territorial Hospital and under the legal guardianship of her mother. Miss Meyer had gone outside of the residence for a cigarette and has not been seen since. There were sightings of her walking in the Con Mine area.  She was taking various medications and did not take the medications with her when she went missing.

Jacket: Nylon, Red, Black, Hip length, black on the back of sleeves

Case reference: 2014006252.CaseDesc: On September 12, 2013, Meagan Rose Pilon was seen for the last time at her family home in Sudbury, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Meagan was living in the New Sudbury area. Police have not been able to rule out foul play in her disappearance.

Mark: Left Chest, Red birthmark on inner left breast

Case reference: 2019016353.CaseDesc: On March 13 2019, Michael Steele was seen for the last time at the Cape Breton Regional Hospital Emergency Department in Sydney, Nova Scotia.

Case reference: 2006022399.CaseDesc: Jocelyn "Josh" Blais was last seen in a bait shop in Ignace, Ontario. He and a friend were headed to Cecil Lake (24 kilometres north of Ignace and 1 kilometre east off Hwy. 599) for a day of fishing. His overturned boat was later discovered.

Case reference: 2018054173.CaseDesc: On September 23, 2018, at approximately 11:00am, Melvin Hillier was last seen at his home in Torbay, Newfoundland.  Melvin had advised his family that he was going for a drive. Melvin’s blue Ford F-150 pick-up truck was later located abandoned on the MV Legionnaire (one of the ferries that operates between Portugal Cove-St. Phillips and Bell Island, Newfoundland). Surveillance footage of the ferry shows Melvin walking around the lounge area during 1:45pm crossing. He was last observed on video between 1:50pm and 1:57pm.

Case reference: 2013000024.CaseDesc: Susan Dawson was living with, and working for, Terry Murphy for approximately 3 weeks prior to her disappearance. She was last seen in the late hours of November 12, 1985 at a gathering at Terry's house. On November 13, a blue car was seen in Terry's yard. On November 14, at approximately 11:55 a.m., a massive explosion occurred at Terry's residence. Terry's remains were found in the debris but there was no indication that Susan was in the house at the time of the explosion. Investigators suspect foul play, and that Terry had some involvement with Susan's disappearance.

Case reference: 2014003950.CaseDesc: Lyndon Fuller was last seen on November 25, 1988, in the area of the local hospital in Berwick, Nova Scotia. Lyndon had jumped from a third floor window following his admission to the hospital. Lyndon left on foot in an unknown direction.

Case reference: 2014001690.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1971, James MacDonald departed Thompson, Manitoba in his "Money Mark 21" aircraft bound for Winnipeg. James never arrived. Despite intensive air search neither Mr. MacDonald nor his aircraft have been located.

Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, engineering ring
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Calendar watch

Case reference: 2021032527.CaseDesc: The last time Robert Martin was heard from or seen was in the late 1960s. He was last observed working as a miner in the North West Territories. Police had unsuccessfully performed searches for birth and death data. Robert's current whereabouts are unknown.

Mark: Abdomen, Birthmark, white patch of skin around the belly button
Forehead, Birthmark, white patch of skin, white hair hairline

Case reference: 2020011692.CaseDesc: Joyce MacDougall was last heard from on March 13, 1986, at approximately 7:30pm. Joyce telephoned her mother to inform her that she was going out for a few drinks, but she never returned home. On March 14, Joyce interacted with the police in Niagara Falls and during the course of the interaction she was issued a ticket and was taken to a restaurant. She was last seen at the restaurant by a server and had left her purse in the restaurant.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the left side of the cheek

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2014005610.CaseDesc: Roman Drag was last seen in the early hours of May 23, 2011 fishing at the top of the Bassano Dam in Bassano, AB. Roman and a friend were night fishing on the shore of the Bow River. His black jacket and fishing gear were found in the place where he was last seen. Search teams located a pair of glasses but were not able to locate Roman.

Case reference: 2014001287.CaseDesc: Lawrence Wellington Allard was last seen in December 1975 in Kamloops, British Columbia.  Lawrence has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018009360.CaseDesc: On February 18, 1987, George Christie was last seen at the intersection of Broadview Avenue and Queen Street East in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005984.CaseDesc: In 1972, Patricia Salamandyk was seen for the last time as she got off of the school bus with her sister in Spruce Grove, Parkland County, in Alberta. Patricia had told her sister that she was not going to school that day, and she has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014006264.CaseDesc: William (Bill) Kwiatek was last seen in Canmore, AB, in July, 1988. He was leaving a bar and was intending to hitchhike back to Calgary but never made it there. Mr. Kwiatek was reported missing in 2013 and very few details of when he was last seen are known.

Amputation: Left Ring Finger, partial missing finger

Case reference: 2022018590.CaseDesc: Xiao Hua Jiang, who goes by her English name “Christina”, was last seen at approximately 1am on April 27, 2022 in West Vancouver, British Columbia. On May 2, 2022, her vehicle, a grey 2021 Toyota Highlander was located abandoned on Highway 1, approximately 20 kilometres east of Rogers Pass, just outside Glacier National Park in British Columbia. The vehicle had sustained mechanical damage rendering it undriveable. Xiao Hua has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015037946.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2015, Raymond Flett was seen for the last time in Thompson, Manitoba. Raymond is known to frequent the Split Lake and Thompson.

Case reference: 2006007399.CaseDesc: On January 5, 1991 Bruce Blimkie left the Riverview Inn in Norway Bay, Quebec, to travel home by snowmobile, across the Ottawa River, to Arnprior, Ontario.  It is believed that Mr. Blimkie was travelling in an area of the Ottawa River where there was open water, and that his snowmobile went through the ice into the water. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014004024.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1989, Ernestine Kasyon was seen for the last time while leaving a residence to use a payphone in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2020011797.CaseDesc: On June 21, 1986, John Edwards was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. John may have been despondent during the time of his disappearance.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, On left bicep

Case reference: 2016008425.CaseDesc: Colleen Sylvia Smith was last seen at home, on February 9, 2016, by her ex-boyfriend/landlord.

Case reference: 2014003102.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1972, David Kyak was seen for the last time in Iqaluit, Nunavut.

Hat: Canvas, Blue, Ball cap, Polar bear crest

Case reference: 2010001999.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Dekleyn was last seen on December 3, 1992, at 1:35 p.m. on a Hamilton RBC bank surveillance camera, making a withdrawal from an ATM machine. Family have not seen or heard from him since and described Mr. Dekleyn as being depressed.

Jacket: Brown, with the Dempsters logo on the left chest
Scar: Torso (Front), Front-to-Back scar on abdomen from surgery to remove kidney.

Case reference: 2014004349.CaseDesc: Candace Giebel was last seen on August 1, 2002. She may have left Vancouver with her boyfriend at that time; her whereabouts and destination are unknown. Her family has not heard from her since her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005826.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2012, the Banff RCMP were contacted by a tour company to report that Duc Dao and his son, Nguyen Dao of Vietnam did not arrive to board their bus at the scheduled time.  The two men had been staying at the Banff International Hotel and there were no personal items left in their room. The two men were due to fly back to Vietnam two days later. However, they did not board their scheduled flight and it is unknown if they returned to Vietnam.

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014004675.CaseDesc: Jean-Louis Bourgeault was last seen on September 12, 2005 in Montreal, Quebec. Jean-Louis left the Suzanne Blanchard Pavillon, a mental health resource linked to the Louis Hippolyte Lafontaine Hospital. Jean-Louis was homeless in downtown Montreal prior to entering the Pavillon.

Case reference: 2014004965.CaseDesc: Cecilia Nikal arrived in Vancouver to visit her mother on August 1, 1989; she then left her mother's house to live on the streets. She was last seen by her mother in October of 1989. A report by a family member that Ms. Nikal had subsequently moved to Vancouver Island was never confirmed.

Case reference: 2014006419.CaseDesc: On January 23, 2014, Ally Hassan Mabruki was seen for the last time at one of Toronto's Refugee Intake Shelters in Ontario. Staff members overheard Ally stating he was going to visit his lawyer regarding his refugee claim.

Case reference: 2010003599.CaseDesc: Alexander McAuley was reported missing by family members on April 23, 2010, after not having any contact with him since 2002. Mr. McAuley was known to lead a high risk lifestyle and may have met with foul play.

Case reference: 2012020029.CaseDesc: Julie Derouin was reported missing to Lethbridge Police in June of 1983. There have been no confirmed sightings of Julie since January 1, 1980. Police investigations continue.

Case reference: 2019058725.CaseDesc: In the spring of 2019, Glenn Field was seen for the last time by a pilot flying over his campsite located at Rolfe Lake, Northwest Territories. Glenn had flown out to Rolfe Lake in September of 2018 with the intentions of spending the winter living on the land and making his way back to Yellowknife, Northwest Territories, in the Spring of 2019. Glenn had three dogs with him and food to last the winter. The RCMP Search and Rescue conducted an areal search of Rolfe Lake in October of 2019, but found no signs of Glenn.

Case reference: 2015059939.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from the water near the Fleet Street Pumping Station, Ottawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 170-180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  It is estimated that he had been in the water between 2 and 3 months.

Case reference: 2006014899.CaseDesc: Robert Commu was last seen at his residence in South Dumfries Township, Ontario on March 31, 1996. At 7:00 p.m. on this date, a neighbour went to the residence and found the front door open and his compact disc player repeatedly playing the same song. Mr. Commu had been despondent over a failed relationship and an illness in the family. Mr. Commu has not contacted any family members or friends since his disappearance.

Jacket: Leather, Black, White, Red Maple leaf on the back
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, lion with wings

Case reference: 2014005318.CaseDesc: In November of 1983, Tony Spalancin was seen for the last time leaving his place of employment in Drayton Valley, Alberta. It is believed that Tony travelled to Calgary, Alberta, to seek new employment. His vehicle was later located in Calgary.

Case reference: 2017060465.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2017, Jesse Clint Galganov was seen for the last time when he took a flight to Peru from the Montréal-Pierre-Elliott Trudeau Airport in Montreal, Quebec. On September 28, 2017, Jesse contacted his mother to tell her that he was going to go hiking for a few days in the forest. Since this time, Jesse has not been seen nor has he contacted his family to provide them with his whereabouts which is contrary to his habits.

Shoes: Black, White, Running shoes with white soles

Case reference: 2014003781.CaseDesc: William Leslie has not been seen or heard from by anyone, including his family, since September, 1993. His belongings were found in a remote area. He had been staying in a tent in the bush Southeast of Beaverlodge in Alberta. It appeared the tent was pitched in the fall of 1993. William's belongings were located under 2-3 feet of snow, along with his truck and bicycle. A jean jacket and leather jacket were located in the truck.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Short on top and long in back
Tattoo: Left Arm, Text "live your own life" in a ribbon
Right Arm, Text "born to be bad" and "Mom Dad"

Case reference: 2021015236.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2018, a woman believed to be Nerissa Cox was last seen in the area of Prospect Point, Niagara Falls in New York. During the time of her disappearance, Nerissa was despondent.

Pierce: Ears, Multiple piercings on both ears
Tattoo: Right Hand, Possibly letters on fingers
Left Hand, Possibly letters on fingers
Right Side Of Neck, Block letters possibly "Boricua"

Case reference: 2013000070.CaseDesc: On June 4, 1980, Serge Jobin was seen for the last time in the De Lorimier district of Montreal, Quebec. He may have taken a bus to New York City in the United States. Serge is hearing impaired and mute.

Case reference: 2014002843.CaseDesc: A party of 6 men departed Churchill, Manitoba, on a fishing trip traveling in three canoes. On June 20, 1967, two of the three canoes became stranded on mud flats at a point where the Hayes and Nelson Rivers empty into the Hudson Bay. The men made camp for the night and then the following day Kurt Hild, Ronald Davidson and James Cochrane all attempted to retrieve the stranded canoes. On return to the camp the men were confronted with high winds and freezing rain which forced them out of sight. None of the remains of the men have been recovered. Foul play is not suspected in the matter.

Case reference: 2020008388.CaseDesc: On December 10, 1982, David Templar was seen for the last time when he was picked up by his father for a visitation. David was to be returned home to his mother on December 12, but never returned. It is believed that his father may have brought him to India.

Coat: Other, Parka; Khaki coloured with white fur trim on hood

Case reference: 2018054180.CaseDesc: On May 8, 1992, John Leonard was seen for the last time when he borrowed a friend's vehicle.  Later that same day, the vehicle was recovered at Woodbine Racetrack in Toronto.

Shoes: Nylon, White, Running shoes with a low cut style
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Pair of dice

Case reference: 2012020016.CaseDesc: Rhody Lake disappeared on Sunday, November 27, 2005.  She was last seen going for a walk in Sechelt's Porpoise Bay Provincial Park located in Sechelt, B.C.

Hat: Red, Orange, Toque - might be beige

Case reference: 2009005499.CaseDesc: Joanne Foley was last seen in May of 1989, when she was staying with friends in Port McNicoll, Ontario.  She had mentioned that she was planning on going to western Canada, but there is no indication that she travelled there.  She has had no contact with friends or relatives since May 1989.

Case reference: 2013000058.CaseDesc: Marie-Berthe Perreault Astle Wiseman has been missing since June 26th 1975. She was last seen in her home located in the suburb of Pointe-Claire in Montreal, Quebec before mysteriously disappearring.
